location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Materials:black ink and red/blue pencil on paper.Dimensions:428 mm x 680 mm.Foliation:The map is foliated in the top right corner, with a circled pencil number. An uncircled number, part of an earlier foliation system, should be disregarded.

mods.abstract: The map indicates British military boundaries in Iraq and Persia [Iran], in the wake of the military reorganisation carried out in the region, as described in the letter from Tenth Army HQ, dated 23 July 1942, to which the map was attached in the file (ff 6-8). The map indicates:inter-army boundaries, in blue pencil, with areas for the Ninth Army, Tenth Army and PIBAS [Persia and Iraq Base lines of communication) shown;boundaries between sub areas, in red pencil, with areas for: Mosul [Al-Mawṣil], Kermanshah [Khorramshahr], Tehran, Baghdad, Ahwaz [Ahvāz], Shaiba [Shu’aiba]);international boundaries, in black dotted line.
